members.name: length
members.comment: Returns the length of the array.

members.name: get
members.comment: Returns the current value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getVolatile(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: set
members.comment: Sets the element at index i to newValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.setVolatile(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: lazySet
members.comment: Sets the element at index i to newValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.setRelease(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: getAndSet
members.comment: Atomically sets the element at index i to newValue and returns the old value, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndSet(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: compareAndSet
members.comment: Atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndSet(java.lang.Object...).

return: true if successful. False return indicates that the actual value was not equal to the expected value.

members.name: weakCompareAndSet
members.comment: Possibly atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.weakCompareAndSetPlain(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: weakCompareAndSetPlain
members.comment: Possibly atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.weakCompareAndSetPlain(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: getAndIncrement
members.comment: Atomically increments the value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndAdd(java.lang.Object...). Equivalent to getAndAdd(i, 1).

members.name: getAndDecrement
members.comment: Atomically decrements the value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndAdd(java.lang.Object...). Equivalent to getAndAdd(i, -1).

members.name: getAndAdd
members.comment: Atomically adds the given value to the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndAdd(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: incrementAndGet
members.comment: Atomically increments the value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndAdd(java.lang.Object...). Equivalent to addAndGet(i, 1).

members.name: decrementAndGet
members.comment: Atomically decrements the value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndAdd(java.lang.Object...). Equivalent to addAndGet(i, -1).

members.name: addAndGet
members.comment: Atomically adds the given value to the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAndAdd(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: getAndUpdate
members.comment: Atomically updates (with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndSet(java.lang.Object...)) the element at index i with the results of applying the given function, returning the previous value. The function should be side-effect-free, since it may be re-applied when attempted updates fail due to contention among threads.

members.name: updateAndGet
members.comment: Atomically updates (with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndSet(java.lang.Object...)) the element at index i with the results of applying the given function, returning the updated value. The function should be side-effect-free, since it may be re-applied when attempted updates fail due to contention among threads.

members.name: getAndAccumulate
members.comment: Atomically updates (with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndSet(java.lang.Object...)) the element at index i with the results of applying the given function to the current and given values, returning the previous value. The function should be side-effect-free, since it may be re-applied when attempted updates fail due to contention among threads. The function is applied with the current value of the element at index i as its first argument, and the given update as the second argument.

param: accumulatorFunction - a side-effect-free function of two arguments

members.name: accumulateAndGet
members.comment: Atomically updates (with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndSet(java.lang.Object...)) the element at index i with the results of applying the given function to the current and given values, returning the updated value. The function should be side-effect-free, since it may be re-applied when attempted updates fail due to contention among threads. The function is applied with the current value of the element at index i as its first argument, and the given update as the second argument.

param: accumulatorFunction - a side-effect-free function of two arguments

members.name: toString
members.comment: Returns the String representation of the current values of array.

return: the String representation of the current values of array

members.name: getPlain
members.comment: Returns the current value of the element at index i, with memory semantics of reading as if the variable was declared non-volatile.

members.name: setPlain
members.comment: Sets the element at index i to newValue, with memory semantics of setting as if the variable was declared non-volatile and non-final.

members.name: getOpaque
members.comment: Returns the current value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getOpaque(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: setOpaque
members.comment: Sets the element at index i to newValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.setOpaque(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: getAcquire
members.comment: Returns the current value of the element at index i, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.getAcquire(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: setRelease
members.comment: Sets the element at index i to newValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.setRelease(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: compareAndExchange
members.comment: Atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value, referred to as the witness value, == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndExchange(java.lang.Object...).

return: the witness value, which will be the same as the expected value if successful

members.name: compareAndExchangeAcquire
members.comment: Atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value, referred to as the witness value, == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndExchangeAcquire(java.lang.Object...).

return: the witness value, which will be the same as the expected value if successful

members.name: compareAndExchangeRelease
members.comment: Atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value, referred to as the witness value, == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.compareAndExchangeRelease(java.lang.Object...).

return: the witness value, which will be the same as the expected value if successful

members.name: weakCompareAndSetVolatile
members.comment: Possibly atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.weakCompareAndSet(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: weakCompareAndSetAcquire
members.comment: Possibly atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.weakCompareAndSetAcquire(java.lang.Object...).

members.name: weakCompareAndSetRelease
members.comment: Possibly atomically sets the element at index i to newValue if the element's current value == expectedValue, with memory effects as specified by VarHandle.weakCompareAndSetRelease(java.lang.Object...).
Creates a new AtomicIntegerArray of the given length, with all elements initially zero.
Creates a new AtomicIntegerArray with the same length as, and all elements copied from, the given array.

param: array - the array to copy elements from
throws: NullPointerException - if array is null

name: java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicIntegerArray
comment: An int array in which elements may be updated atomically. See the VarHandle specification for descriptions of the properties of atomic accesses.
